00027 template <unsigned D>
00028     class vertex_data {
00029 
00030         public:
00031             void print();           
00032 
00033         protected:
00035             typedef std::vector<unsigned> uintvec1D;
00037             typedef std::vector<uintvec1D> uintvec2D;
00038 
00040 
00041             vertex_data():_dimension(0), _X(), _surface() {
00042                 _X.push_back(VecMath::Vector<D>());
00043             }
00044 
00046             void addSurface(unsigned, unsigned, unsigned, unsigned);
00048             void addSurface(unsigned, unsigned, unsigned);
00049 
00050             unsigned &dimension() { return _dimension; }
00051             std::vector<VecMath::Vector<D> > &X() { return _X; }
00052             uintvec2D &surface() { return _surface; }
00053 
00054         private:
00055             unsigned _dimension;
00056             std::vector<VecMath::Vector<D> > _X;    
00057             uintvec2D _surface;                     
00058     };
00059 
00060 /*  You shouldn't use "using" directives in a header file, but the code gets
00061     nearly unreadable otherwise:
00062     typename std::vector<VecMath::Vector<D> >::iterator i = _X.begin();
00063     And because I'm defining template classes here, code must be written in the
00064     header file anyway.
00065 */
00066 using VecMath::Vector;
00067 using std::vector;
00068 
00069 #include <iomanip>
00070 
00071 template <unsigned D> void vertex_data<D>::print() {
00072     std::cerr << _dimension << "-dimensional object: ";
00073     std::string separator = "";
00074     for(typename vector<Vector<D> >::iterator i = _X.begin();
00075         i != _X.end(); ++i){
00076         std::cerr << separator << *i;
00077         separator = ", ";
00078     }
00079     std::cerr << "\n";
00080 
00081 #   if 1
00082         std::cerr << "Surfaces: \n";
00083         for (unsigned i = 0; i < _surface.size(); ++i) {
00084             std::cerr << std::setw(4) << i << " (";
00085             separator = "";
00086             for (uintvec1D::iterator j = _surface[i].begin();
00087                  j != _surface[i].end(); ++j) {
00088                 std::cerr << separator << std::setw(4) << *j;
00089                 separator = ", ";
00090             }
00091             std::cerr << ")\n";
00092         }
00093         std::cerr << "\n";
00094 #   endif
00095 
00096 }
00097 
00104 template <unsigned D> void vertex_data<D>::addSurface(unsigned v1, unsigned v2,
00105                                                       unsigned v3, unsigned v4) {
00106     if (v1 >= _X.size() || v2 >= _X.size() ||
00107         v3 >= _X.size() || v4 >= _X.size()) {
00108         throw std::out_of_range("vertex_data<D>::addSurface(): index larger "
00109                                 "than size of vertex array");
00110     }
00111 
00112     uintvec1D tmp;
00113     tmp.push_back(v1); tmp.push_back(v2); tmp.push_back(v3); tmp.push_back(v4);
00114 
00115     _surface.push_back(tmp);
00116 }
00117 
00123 template <unsigned D> void vertex_data<D>::addSurface(unsigned v1, unsigned v2,
00124                                                       unsigned v3) {
00125     addSurface(v1, v2, v3, v3);
00126 }

00128 #endif
